StoryText: My father gives me $30 to go buy lunch for the family.
Question: What do I get?

OptionText.Text: Spend the $30 at the taco place
Spend the $30 at the popular French restaurant

OptionResult.Result: My father is proud I made a good decision and got a lot of food for the money, he gives me $10 to keep.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Hey, my father was proud of me for making a good economical decision, we had plenty to eat AND I got some extra money from him! I might always choose tacos now.

OptionResult.Result: My father is upset I wasted the money and brought home barely any food. But it’s so delicious.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: That French food was so good, but we didn’t quite have enough to fill us all up, I definitely see why my father got so mad at me. Whoops! At least it was tasty food.

OptionResult.Result: My father is proud I spent the money wisely and returned the money. But I got food poisoning from my sandwich.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father was happy with my decision on lunch and I guess I did feel responsible bringing the money back. But I don’t feel so hot after that sandwich...

OptionResult.Result: My father doesn’t say it, but he knows I kept money and is upset. Also he gets food poisoning from his sandwich and I feel guilty.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: This went terribly, my father was visibly annoyed, I think he knew I kept extra money and he got sick! I feel like it’s all my fault... at least I got some extra cash I guess?
